page.title: 08Richmond, North Yorkshire. 2
page.content: The{Castle},started in 1071, contains an 11th Century{Great Hall}and with one exception{(Chepstow Castle)}is the oldest building of its kind in {Britain}.The 12th century keep, at 100ft tall, is one of the highest in {England}. Much of the original{Norman stonework can still be seen. In 1983 75,900 people visited{Richmond Castle. The clock tower, which dominates the market place, is part of a small church,{Trinity Church}, which is still in regular use. It is unique in having shops and a museum built into the southside of it. { Richmond}also boasts a{Georgian {Theatre}which was built in 1788 and is the oldest theatre in the country still in regular use. Seating just 230 people, it was fully restored by 1963 and is in regular use by amateur and professional groups.
